Description: Grey and white striated crystalline marble tall shouldered vase: with flat base and convex body with two horizontally pierced tubular handles and a broad flat-topped rim, the outer surface of the handles is concave, interior well hollowed, this vase has clearly been made with exceptional care.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, p. 173, pl. on p. 173.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.173)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
